extendedIngredients.name: red beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 (12 ounce) packages Green Giant Green Beans

extendedIngredients.name: alpine lace pre- deli cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 slices Alpine Lace Pre-Sliced Deli Cheese, cut in half diagonally

recipes.title: BBQ Chicken Crescent Roll Ups

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. You could try Downton Abbey Countess of Grantham Chardonnay. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 16 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Downton Abbey Countess of Grantham Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Our Downton Abbey Chardonnay displays lovely aromas of tropical fruits and subtle oak on the nose, which give way to flavors of citrus and fresh-cut pineapple on a soft, silky palate. The wine's bright characters and luscious mouthfeel continue through a clean, medium finish. The beautifully balanced and food-friendly bottling is the perfect wine choice for you most regal gatherings or spontaneous get-togethers.

recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 375F.Mix together the cream cheese, onion powder, and garlic powder. Set aside.Mix together the BBQ sauce and shredded chicken.Unroll the crescent rolls and pull them apart at the perforations. Place a triangle of cheese on each roll at the bottom (see crescent roll package instructions for where the "bottom" is located; it will be the portion of the roll that you roll away from you).Top the cheese with a spoonful of the BBQ chicken and then a teaspoon of the cream cheese mixture.Roll the stuffed crescent up and place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 12 minutes.While the crescents bake, place the green beans in a deep pan with about 2 inches of water. Cover and let the water come to a boil. After 3 minutes drain the green beans. Add the oil and garlic to the pot. Add the green beans back in and toss everything together over medium high heat. Sprinkle with the panko bread crumbs and kosher salt to taste.Serve everything hot.

steps.step: Mix together the cream cheese, onion powder, and garlic powder. Set aside.
Mix together the BBQ sauce and shredded chicken.Unroll the crescent rolls and pull them apart at the perforations.

Place a triangle of cheese on each roll at the bottom (see crescent roll package instructions for where the "bottom" is located; it will be the portion of the roll that you roll away from you).Top the cheese with a spoonful of the BBQ chicken and then a teaspoon of the cream cheese mixture.
Roll the stuffed crescent up and place on an ungreased baking sheet.
Bake for 12 minutes.While the crescents bake, place the green beans in a deep pan with about 2 inches of water. Cover and let the water come to a boil. After 3 minutes drain the green beans.
Add the oil and garlic to the pot.
Add the green beans back in and toss everything together over medium high heat. Sprinkle with the panko bread crumbs and kosher salt to taste.
